headline: Indian e-commerce firm Meesho leans on AI, new business lines to drive growth
summary: SoftBank-backed Indian e-commerce firm Meesho is doubling down on artificial intelligence and new business lines ​to expand its user base and move towards profitability, founder and CEO Vidit Aatrey ‌told Reuters in an interview.  The firm, which is seeking a valuation of up to $5.6 billion through its ‌initial public offering, competes with Amazon.com and Walmart-owned Flipkart in India's online retail market, which is expected to reach $170-$190 billion by 2030, according to a report by Bain and Flipkart.  Its three-day share sale will begin on December 3, with shares expected to debut on ⁠India's main stock exchanges on ‌December 10.

content.title: Indian e-commerce firm Meesho leans on AI, new business lines to drive growth
content.summary: SoftBank-backed Indian e-commerce firm Meesho is doubling down on artificial intelligence and new business lines ​to expand its user base and move towards profitability, founder and CEO Vidit Aatrey ‌told Reuters in an interview. Its three-day share sale will begin on December 3, with shares expected to debut on ⁠India's main stock exchanges on ‌December 10.

headline: Cyber Monday: Consumers expected to spend record $14.2 billion
summary: The online shopping deals aren't stopping as consumers search for value on Cyber Monday. Adobe Analytics expects shoppers to spend $14.2 billion in Cyber Monday purchases, up 6.3% from last year. Yahoo Finance senior retail reporter Brooke DiPalma takes a look at spending trends, while looking ahead to the major retailers expected to report earnings this week. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

Yahoo Finance senior retail reporter Brooke DiPalma takes a look at spending trends, while looking ahead to the major retailers expected to report earnings this week.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Cyber Monday: Consumers search for value in K-shaped economy
summary: In spite of growing concerns of an affordability crisis in the US, consumers are spending big at the start of the holiday shopping season. Adobe Analytics expects consumers to spend a record $14.2 billion on Cyber Monday purchases. Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma, Winthrop Capital CIO Adam Coons, and HSBC Head of Equity Strategy for the Americas Nicole Inui comment on the state of the US consumer under the pressure of a K-shaped economy. headline: Amazon’s AI chatbot Rufus drove sales on Black Friday
summary: On Black Friday, Amazon sessions that resulted in a sale were up 100% in the U.S. when the AI chatbot Rufus was used. They only increased by 20% when Rufus wasn't used.

content.title: Amazon’s AI chatbot Rufus drove sales on Black Friday
content.summary: On Black Friday, Amazon sessions that resulted in a sale were up 100% in the U.S. when the AI chatbot Rufus was used. They only increased by 20% when Rufus wasn't used.

headline: Why Cyber Monday could break spending records despite economic uncertainty
summary: After four days of deal-fueled spending sprees that kicked off on Thanksgiving, shoppers shifted their focus on Cyber Monday, which is expected to once again be the biggest sales day of the year for online retailers.  Experts expect consumers to drive record Cyber Monday spending this year, despite wider economic uncertainty.  Adobe Analytics estimates that U.S. shoppers will spend $14.2 billion online Monday, or 6.3% more than in 2024.

content.title: Why Cyber Monday could break spending records despite economic uncertainty
content.summary: After four days of deal-fueled spending sprees that kicked off on Thanksgiving, shoppers shifted their focus on Cyber Monday, which is expected to once again be the biggest sales day of the year for online retailers.  Experts expect consumers to drive record Cyber Monday spending this year, despite wider economic uncertainty.  Adobe Analytics estimates that U.S. shoppers will spend $14.2 billion online Monday, or 6.3% more than in 2024.

thumbnail.caption: Shoppers browse for Black Friday deals at Atlantic Station outdoor mall, Friday, Nov. 28, 2025, in Atlanta, Ga. (AP Photo/Megan Varner)

headline: Cyber Monday sales to hit $14 billion, fueled by AI, Adobe forecasts
summary:
STORY: U.S. consumers are expected to spend more than $14 billion on Cyber Monday, building on strong Black Friday momentum.

:: File

That's according to Adobe Analytics, which said AI-powered shopping tools should help boost Cyber Monday sales by 6.3% from a year earlier.

Adobe Analytics tracks 1 trillion visits by shoppers to online retail websites.

Cyber Monday is traditionally seen as the country's biggest online shopping day, and marks the culmination of the Thanksgiving shopping weekend.

Black Friday kicked off the weekend with a record $11.8 billion in online sales, according to Adobe, as consumers switched to chatbots to compare prices amid concerns about tariff-driven price hikes.

U.S. retailers have also doubled down on AI tools to lure shoppers.

Adobe expects AI-driven traffic to retail sites to rise by 670% compared to last year, when AI tools like Walmart's Sparky or Amazon's Rufus had not yet been launched.

content.title: Cyber Monday sales to hit $14 billion, fueled by AI, Adobe forecasts
